title: Cyclist suffers suspected broken ankle after colliding with car in Billingham
content:
A cyclist suffered a suspected broken ankle after colliding with a car in Billingham.

The accident, involving a black Lexus car, happened on the Bypass Road near the Esso garage at around 8.10am today.

A 32-year-old man treated at the scene for a suspected broken ankle before being taken to hospital.

The road was partially blocked for around an hour causing rush hour delays for those travelling between Billingham and Norton.

The driver of the car was uninjured.
